intro: Daucus yemensis, commonly known as the Yemen fennel, is a flowering plant native to Yemen. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Daucus yemensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
